name: Bean

careGuide.water: Drought-tolerant. Allow the soil to dry completely between watering.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once in spring.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Paypaya (Carica papaya) is a fruit bearing plants that origimnates from Central America. Papaya is used for culinary purpose most often is southeast Asia and south America .Papaya can be turned into salads,curry,pickled dishes or it can simply be eaten raw
diseases: Root rot; glasshouse red spider mite, glasshouse thrips, glasshouse whitefly
gardenUse: Papaya trees can be planted in the garden, for private enjoyment of its edible fruit and large leaves. It's best to plant two or three to ensure proper pollination. They do well along walls, fences, or buildings. Companion plants to the papaya are Ginger, Banana, and Palm trees.

name: Bottle_Gourd

careGuide.water: watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every half month during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Bottle gourd (Lagenaria siceraria) is an annual vine that is considered easy to grow from its seeds. This species is also known as calabash. This gourd is edible and is also used to make bowls and musical instruments.

name: Cabbage

careGuide.water: Moisture-loving, keep the soil moist but do not let water accumulate.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once in spring.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.

conditions.difficulty: Cabbage is super easy to take care of, with resistance to almost all pests and diseases. It is a perfect option for gardeners with brown thumbs.
conditions.soil: Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: A member of the brassica family, cabbage grows well in cool weather and full sun. It can be eaten raw, shredded in salads, or in SOUP, and is fermented to make sauerkraut.
diseases: Aphids, clubroot, downy mildew, leaf spot

name: Capsicum

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the dead, diseased, overgrown branches in winter.

conditions.difficulty: Capsicum is not diffcult to take care of .
conditions.soil: Soil Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral

description: The cayenne pepper is a plant that produces bright red pepper vegetables. This chili pepper is commonly used for cooking in places such as the Southern U.S. and Central America. Most are moderately spicy, though because there are so many variants, the spice level can vary dramatically. Cayenne powder is also a popular seasoning product made from cayenne pepper plants.
diseases: Rot; grass house red spider mite, aphids
gardenUse: The many cultivars of cayenne pepper are commonly grown by veggie gardeners as annuals in warmer climates to use in their home kitchen and add a bit of color to their garden.

name: Carrot
description: Carrot (Daucus carota subsp. sativus) is the domestic version of its wild relative. This ubiquitous vegetable is closely related to parsley, fennel, and dill. The orange root can be eaten cooked or raw. The carrot is self-fertile and is pollinated by flies and beetles, who use its flowers as a food source.

name: Cauliflower

careGuide.water: Moisture-loving, keep the soil moist but do not let water accumulate.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once in spring.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month
careGuide.harvestTime: Mid summer, Late summer, Early autumn

conditions.difficulty: Cauliflower is super easy to take care of, with resistance to almost all pests and diseases. It is a perfect option for gardeners with brown thumbs.
conditions.soil: Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Cauliflower (Brassica oleracea var. botrytis) has been a common cool-season vegetable since Greek and Roman times. The large head is usually white, but purple, green, and orange cultivars are available.Cauliflower is a valuable source of vitamins B, C, and K. It is a popular alternative to rice and potatoes in low-carbohydrate diets.
diseases: Aphids, clubroot, downy mildew, leaf spot

name: Cucumbers

careGuide.water: Moisture-loving, keep the soil moist but do not let water accumulate.

conditions.difficulty: Cucumbers is super easy to take care of, with resistance to almost all pests and diseases. It is a perfect option for gardeners with brown thumbs.
conditions.soil: Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Cucumbers (Cucumjs sativus) is a creeping vine native to South Asia. It has a long history of cultivation - mentions of its use are found in various ancient scripts, including the Bible, Epic of Gilgamesh and Pliny the Elder's Natural History. Today, cucumbers is one of the most widely cultivated vegetable species in the world.
diseases: Powdery mildew, downy mildew, fungal infestation; aphids, caterpillars, red spider mites, whiteflies,thrips
gardenUse: An absolute essential in veggie gardens, the cucumbers is one of the most commonly grown garden vegetables around the world. Its ease of care makes it widely valued by gardeners. Cucumbers plants will benefit from being grown with corn or sunflowers, which act as natural trellises. You can also plant them with marigolds to help repel bugs.

name: Papaya

careGuide.water: Drought-tolerant. Allow the soil to dry completely between watering.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once in spring.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Paypaya (Carica papaya) is a fruit bearing plants that origimnates from Central America. Papaya is used for culinary purpose most often is southeast Asia and south America .Papaya can be turned into salads,curry,pickled dishes or it can simply be eaten raw
diseases: Root rot; glasshouse red spider mite, glasshouse thrips, glasshouse whitefly
gardenUse: Papaya trees can be planted in the garden, for private enjoyment of its edible fruit and large leaves. It's best to plant two or three to ensure proper pollination. They do well along walls, fences, or buildings. Companion plants to the papaya are Ginger, Banana, and Palm trees.

name: Potato

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Time Spring

conditions.difficulty: Potato is super easy to take care of,  with resistance to almost all pests and diseases. It is a perfect option for gardeners with brown thumbs.
conditions.soil: Soil Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Cultivated first by the Incas of Peru, the humble potato was introduced to Europe in the late 18th century. Now eaten the world over, the UK alone produces a yearly volume of 5.37 Mt. The potato can be fried, baked, curried, mashed and pretty much any other cooking method you can think of.
diseases: Powdery mildew, powdery scab, leafroll virus; colorado potato beetle, potato tuber moth, green peach aphid
gardenUse: Potato is a starchy tuber commonly grown in edible gardens and containers. They are grown and kept for consumption in a range of dishes. The potato can be grown alongside several plants — such as horseradish, marigolds, and nasturtiums —that repel pests, like Colorado potato beetles. It also does well when planted near edible options like cilantro, legumes, cabbage, corn, and chives.

name: Pumpkin

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.

characteristics.habitat: Meadows, fields, shores of rivers or lakes

conditions.soil: Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Field pumpkin are most commonly seen as decorations throughout the autumn and during the Halloween holiday, when they are carved and used as traditional jack-o'-lanterns. While the taste of field pumpkin flesh may not be ideal, eating the seeds after toasting them with a bit of salt can be a delicious treat!
diseases: Squash vine borers, squash bugs, powdery mildew, mosaic disease, downy mildew, leaf spot, wilt disease, aphids, thrips
gardenUse: Field pumpkin is often planted by enterprising backyard gardeners hoping to grow some of their own produce at home. This plant is highly popular for its appearance and the popular fruit it produces. A mainstay of the backyard vegetable garden, field pumpkin is best planted with beans, borage, dill, garlic, and oregano for the health of the soil and insect-repelling properties.

name: Radish

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.

conditions.soil: Well drained

description: Radish (Raphanus sativus) is a plant species that represents a food staple in many cultures around the world. The radish has a wide range of variations, including variants that grow in the spring, summer and winter. The root is generally eaten raw and can be used in salads or as a garnish.
gardenUse: Radish is mostly planted in fields. This plant also can be spotted in vegetable gardens, where it is appreciated for its nutritious produce. Called a  it pulls pests like aphids and flea beetles away from peppers, squash, and other vegetables. For this reason, it does very well in vegetable patches and is a good choice in cottage gardens. Companion plants include those listed above, with the radish being planted alongside those to act as a sacrificial plant to pests.

name: Tomato

careGuide.water: The tomato should be watered very often in the active growing season during the late spring and summer months. Depending on how much sunlight and heat they receive, it is advisible to water these plants at most daily or at least twice weekly. The soil should be kept consistently moist without becoming wet or soggy.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the dead, diseased, overgrown branches in winter.

conditions.difficulty: tomato is super easy to take care of, with resistance to almost all pests and diseases. It is a perfect option for gardeners with brown thumbs.
conditions.soil: Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral

description: Solanum lycopersicum is an annual or perennial herbaceous vine native to Central and South America that produces a large, juicy, edible fruit known as tomato. Today there are over 10000 cultivated varieties. Although tomato is the world's most popular vegetable, botanically it is a fruit.
diseases: Whiteflies, cotton bollworms, aphids, tomato brake leaf virus, stripe virus, mosaic disease, leaf mold, late blight, grey mold, early blight, anthracnose, leaf spot, colorado potato beetles, leaf miners
gardenUse: The common tomato can be found in vegetable gardens across the world. Able to be grown in almost any space, the tomato is considered a staple in home food gardens and is usually the one of the first plants suggested to new vegetable gardeners, though it can be a bit tricky. Basil, parsley, and garlic are suggested companion plants.

name: apple

careGuide.water: Drought-tolerant. Allow the soil to dry completely between watering.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once a month during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Deadhead (or remove) withered flowers after flowering.
careGuide.harvestTime: Late winter, Spring, Early summer, Mid summer

characteristics.habitat: Thickets, forests, fields,fence edges, shores, roadsides

conditions.difficulty: Growing Paradise apple is easy as long as you can give them what they need. They are sensitive to certain types of pests and diseases.
conditions.soil: Chalky, loam, clay, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Paradise apple is the most widely cultivated tree fruit around the globe. The three top apple- producing countries are China, the United States, and Poland with an economic impact of $3.55 billion in 2017. There are more than 7,500 known cultivars of apples throughout the world
diseases: Codling moths, oriental fruit moths, aphids, ring rot, black rot, bitter rot, alternaria leaf blotch
gardenUse: Beauty Improvement Value Removes acne and whitens. Usage: make tea with apple flower, rose, and orange flower, with a unique taste.

name: Apricot

careGuide.water: Drought-tolerant. Allow the soil to dry completely between watering.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the dead, diseased, overgrown branches in winter.
careGuide.plantingTime: Late autumn, Early winter, Mid winter

conditions.soil: Sand, chalky, loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Apricot (Prunus armeniaca) is a fruit-bearing plant species native to Asia. Although the genus name, Prunus,means plum, the fruits of this tree are actually apricots. The seeds are occasionally used as substitutes for almonds because they share a similar shape and nutty taste. The apricot has been cultivated by humans for centuries, and was even discovered in the remains of ancient Armenian settlements.
gardenUse: Apricot is a popular tree in yards and established groves where the trees are prized for their sweet fruit. The trees are usually grown specifically for their fruits and are often paired with marigolds, rosemary, stevia, and thyme due to their soil compatibility.

name: avocado

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every half month during the growing season.

characteristics.habitat: Humid lowland forests on limestone formations

conditions.difficulty: Avocado is super easy to take care of, with resistance to almost all pests and diseases. It is a perfect option for gardeners with brown thumbs.
conditions.soil: Loam; well drained; neutral

description: Persea americana, widely known as the avocado plant, is an evergreen tree (semi-deciduous in cooler climates) that is native to Central America. It is cultivated all over the world for its nutritious fruits. Avocado has become an important plant in many cuisines due to its high nutrient and fat content, creamy texture, and distinct taste.
diseases: Fungal leafspots, root rots phytophthora; glasshouse whitefly, thrips, glasshouse red spider  mite, mealybug
gardenUse: Avocado can be used as greening plants.

name: banana
description: Main articles: Banana and Cooking plantain Almost all cultivated plantains and many cultivated bananas are triploid cultivars of M. x paradisiaca. It is believed that Southeast Asian farmers first domesticated M. acuminata.

name: beetroot

careGuide.water: Water Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once in spring.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the dead, diseased, overgrown branches in winter.

characteristics.habitat: Coastal cliffs, stony, sandy beaches, salt marshes or coastal grasslands, ruderal or disturbed places

conditions.soil: Soil Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral,slighty alkaline

description: The beet (Beta vulgaris) provides a variety of uses for food products and garden growth. The roots are commonly consumed as nutrient-rich vegetables, the body of the sugar beet is used to make table sugar, and the leaves are harvested as a separate vegetable: chard. In 18th-Century Silesia, an area that is now part of Poland, the first-ever beet sugar extraction plant was created by a royal decree from the king.
diseases: Pear scab, europaean pear rust, brown rot, blossom wilt, fireblight; aphids, caterpillars, codling moth, pear blister mite, pear midge, slugs
gardenUse: The common pear tree it can be a lovely addition to a landscape or garden. Primarily grown for its fruit, it is not often used as an ornamental. Common pear trees will, however, produce lovely flowers and provide a nice shaded area in the lawn. It can make a wonderful addition as a border tree to provide privacy as well since its branches and leaves grow quite densely. Common herbs, allium, and clover are great companions.

name: bell papper

careGuide.water: average water needs ,watering when the top 1.2 inch of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 month during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Deadhead flowers after flowering.

conditions.soil: Soil Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral

description: Soybean (Glycine max ) was domesticated by the chinese 6000 to 9000 years ago.In the eighteenth century,Europeans used soybean for ornamental purposes .Its a versatile plantgrown both for consumption and as an ingredient in manufactured products.
diseases: Anthracnose,southern blight,leaf miners

name: Cantaloupe

careGuide.water: Moisture-loving, keep the soil moist but do not let water accumulate
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Cucumis melo includes a variety of melons, including honeydew, cantaloupe, and muskmelon. These melons are an excellent source of vitamins A and C and are commonly eaten fresh or dried. It is occasionally turned into oil or liqueur.
gardenUse: The cantaloupe is a commercial fruit crop that can also be grown in home food gardens in containers or in the ground. This climbing plant is most often grown for its melon-like fruits. Gardeners can complement the cantaloupe by planting Corn, Beans, and Sunflower plants.

name: chili pepper

careGuide.water: average water needs ,watering when the top 1.2 inch of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 month during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Deadhead flowers after flowering.

conditions.soil: Soil Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral

description: The peppers is a plant that produces bright red pepper vegetables. This chili pepper is commonly used for cooking in places such as the Southern U.S. and Central America. Most are moderately spicy, though because there are so many variants, the spice level can vary dramatically. Cayenne powder is also a popular seasoning product made from peppers plants.
diseases: Rots; grass house red spider mite;aphids
gardenUse: The many cultivars of peppers are commonly grown by veggie gardeners as annuals in warmer climates to use in their home kitchens and add a bit of color to their garden. However, peppers plants are sometimes planted in their own area in vegetable gardens, as it can easily outcompete other plants with its prolific seeds; but herbs and other veggies like tomatoes can be solid companions.

name: Coconut

careGuide.water: watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Common coconut palm (Cocos nucifera) is a broadleaf evergreen native to the Western Pacific tropical islands. In the United States, common coconut palm grows in Hawaii, Southern Florida, and Texas. This tree produces coconuts.
diseases: Phytophthora; african armyworm, batrachedra
gardenUse: Common coconut palm is a popular tree in landscaped yards prized for its long life and the oils contained in the round fruits. The tree's height and broad leaves provide ground cover, and it is useful for edging. Its fragrant flowers growing in clusters make it an essential plant in tropical gardens. Plant low-growing plants near it like Muhly grass, railroad vine, Indian hawthorne, and dwarf oleander to complement common coconut palm's shape.

name: Coffee

careGuide.water: Average water needs,watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Arabian coffee (Coffea arabica) is a broadleaf evergreen species native to Ethiopia. Arabian coffee has been cultivated on the Arabian Peninsula for over 1,000 years. This species is currently commercially grown in tropical and subtropical regions all over the planet. The plant is aromatic and smells like jasmine.
diseases: Mealybugs, red spider mites, scale insects, thrips
gardenUse: Arabian coffee is the most commonly grown coffee bean around the world. For landscaping, it is often used to add a tropical feel without taking up too much space since it doesn't grow very large. It is used to add appealing color to a garden and for its coffee beans. It can be found in botanical gardens and in the sunny spots of hobby gardens. Its companion plants include azaleas, carrots, and radishes, which thrive in the same soil and can be boosted by the acid of this plant.

name: Daisy

careGuide.water: Moisture-loving, keep the soil moist but do not let water accumulate.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Shasta Daisy (Leucanthemum superbum) is a flowering herbaceous perennial plant named after Mount Shasta. It is a popular garden plant often cultivated for groundcover. Some species in the same genus are considered noxious weeds.
diseases: Aphids, linear animals

name: Dandelion

careGuide.water: Common dandelion grows best in consistently moist conditions, so the trick is to water these plants lightly and often, taking care to make sure that the soil is moist but not waterlogged. Check whether the soil is dry at a depth of 5 cm; if so, then it's time to water again.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once in spring.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: The common dandelion is seen by many gardeners as a pest, but children love to play with the clocks that are produced after flowering – to tell the time, blow the seeds away and count how many blows.

name: Date

careGuide.water: Drought-tolerant. Allow the soil to dry completely between watering.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once a month during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Shape the plant every 2 months during the growing season.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: The date palm is a palm tree grown for its fruit. We’re unsure of this plant’s endemic region, but it’s now cultivated in many areas of the world. “Dactylifera” from the plant's Latin name means both “date” and “finger” in Greek, which is unsurprising as it's often said that this plant resembles a finger because of its long shape.
diseases: Red palm beetle
gardenUse: Date palm is a popular tree in yards prized for its clusters of small fruits. It is commonly used for the fruit it produces and is an essential tree in Mediterranean gardens. Plant bromeliads, crotons, orchids, cordylines, caladiums, hibiscus, and cannas with it to add color and texture

name: Dragonfruit

careGuide.water: Average water needs,watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once in spring.
careGuide.pruning: Deadhead (or remove) withered flowers after flowering.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Dragon fruit is part of the cactus family. It’s grown for its fruit, but also ornamentally because of its appealing vines. This plant remains mysterious; we still don’t know exactly where it originated from. Fascinatingly, it can grow on rocks and other plants without damaging them. When in bloom, the flowers stay closed in the day, only opening during the night.
diseases: Spider mites, aphids, virus disease, stem rot, root-knot nematode, anthracnose, mealy bugs, rodents
gardenUse: Commonly planted as an ornamental vine and a fruit crop, dragon fruit can climb surfaces such as fences and trees. Tolerant of full sun, the dragon fruit is ideal for xeriscaping but can be planted in containers as well. Companion plants include Texas sage, ice plant, and kalanchoe.
known: Belle of the night Strawberry pear

name: eggplant(Brinjal)

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.
careGuide.harvestTime: Spring, Summer, Autumn, Early winter, Mid winter

conditions.soil: Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Eggplant (Solanum melongena) is a plant species related to nightshade and native to India. Eggplant is grown worldwide for its edible purple fruit. The spongey and absorbent fruit is a staple in Eastern cuisines. This plant is known as brinjal. in South Africa and Asia, while Britains call it aubergine.
diseases: Powdery mildew, downy mildew, fungal infection; aphids, caterpillars, red spider mites, thrips, whiteflies
gardenUse: Eggplant is a popular addition to many vegetable gardens, given the myriad culinary options for preparing the mature fruit. It couples well with tomatoes and others from the nightshade family, but gardeners should be sure to rotate planting with non-solanaceous crops.

name: Fig

careGuide.water: Drought-tolerant. Allow the soil to dry completely between watering.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once in spring.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Common fig leaves are said to be what biblical characters Adam and Eve used to protect their modesty. The tree even has its own pollinator, the fig wasp, that collects pollen from a hole in the base of the flower.
diseases: Spider mites, Thrips, Thripidae, and scale insects
gardenUse: Papaya trees can be planted in the garden, for private enjoyment of its edible fruit and large leaves. It's best to plant two or three to ensure proper pollination. They do well along walls, fences, or buildings. Companion plants to the papaya are Ginger, Banana, and Palm trees.

name: garlic

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during thegrowing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the dead, diseased, overgrown branches in winter.

conditions.soil: Sand, clay, chalky; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Garlic (Allium sativum) is an extremely popular garden plant because of its use for flavoring dishes, as well as its ease of care and growth. It is traditionally planted in autumn and harvested in mid- summer. This plant is also called the stinking rose, and it is useful as an insect repellent in gardens. Garlic is important to Korean creation myths, and is believed to ward off vampires and other spirits in European folklore.
diseases: Downy mildew, onion white rot; slugs, snails

name: ginger

careGuide.harvestTime: Late summer, Early autumn, Mid autumn

description: Ginger (Zingiber officinale) is an edible, herbaceous perennial species native to Southest Asia. The root is used commonly throughout the world as a spice and flavoring. This species is related to turmeric and cardamom. Ginger has been cultivated for centuries; it was used in ancient Greece and Rome and was important to the historical spice trade.

name: grapes

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.
careGuide.harvestTime: Mid autumn, Late autumn, Late winter, Mid spring, Late spring

conditions.difficulty: Growing Wine grape is easy as long as you can give them what they need. They are sensitive to certain types of pests and diseases.
conditions.soil: Sand, chalky, loam; well drained; neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Wine grape (Vitis vinifera) is a woody, fruit-bearing vine with a very long and vivid history of cultivation for culinary, recreational, and ritualistic purposes most notably in winemaking. The earliest known evidence of domesticated wine grapes has been identified in Georgia, and carbon dating traces its domestic origins all the way back to 6000 BC. In addition to wine, the fruit of the wine grape is eaten in the form of grapes, raisins, and currants.
diseases: Powdery mildew, grey moulds; glasshouse red spider mite, spider mite, mealybugs, wasps
gardenUse: While wine grape vines are not often grown outside of commercial production, the plant's vibrant leaves and plump fruit make it a highly valued perennial amongst those willing to take on the challenge. When grown in informal gardens, wine grape vines can form an overhead canopy with the proper support, making a lovely shaded patio area. Rose plants are typically planted near the vines, and oregano, basil, and clover also make excellent companions.

name: Guava

careGuide.water: Average water needs,watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once in spring.
careGuide.pruning: Shape the plant every 2 months during the growing season.

characteristics.habitat: Disturbed places, pastures, plantations, other similar habitats

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Guava (Psidium guajava) is a fruit-producing evergreen shrub that grows natively in the Caribbean region and South America. Guava attracts the honey bee and other insects. Guava fruit is edible and guava wood is used for smoking meat

name: Jalepeno

careGuide.water: watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: TTrim the dead, diseased, overgrown branches in winter.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: The cayenne pepper is a plant that produces bright red pepper vegetables. This chili pepper is commonly used for cooking in places such as the Southern U.S. and Central America. Most are moderately spicy, though because there are so many variants, the spice level can vary dramatically. Cayenne powder is also a popular seasoning product made from cayenne pepper plants.

name: kiwi

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once in spring.

conditions.soil: Sand, loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Kiwi (Actinidia chinensis) is a woody deciduous vine that can grow to be 6 m long. It grows in thickets, ravines and on slopes. It is considered invasive in North Carolina. It grows best in full sun or semi- shade. The edible fruit has a smooth bronze skin with green or yellow flesh.

name: lemon

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every half month during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Shape the plant every 2 months during the growing season.

conditions.difficulty: Growing Lemon is easy as long as you can give them what they need. They are sensitive to certain types of pests and diseases.
conditions.soil: Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutralTree

description: Lemon is a cultivated small evergreen tree known for its yellow, juicy, sour fruits full of citric acid. Its origins are unknown, but it was probably first created in India, China, or Burma as a hybrid of sour orange (Citrus x aurantium) and citron (Citrus medica). It is commercial fruit cultivated in warm regions around the world.
diseases: Thrips, spider mites, scale insects, leaf miners, aphids, sooty mold, gummosis, anthracnose
gardenUse: Though lemon trees are typically grown commercially, they have seen a jump in popularity in home gardens. Their compact size (they can even be grown indoors), attractive leaves, and bright, tasty fruit have made them a staple in warmer- climate regions, particularly in Mediterranean-style gardens. Planting a lime tree nearby will help pollinate your lemon tree, and lemon balm will help deter harmful caterpillars. Roses, geraniums, and jasmine work great when planted under lemon trees.

name: lettuce

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.

characteristics.leaf: White , Yellow , Purple , Green , Red , Gold , Variegated

conditions.soil: Sand, loam; well drained; neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Garden lettuce (Lactuca sativa) is a hardy annual plant commonly cultivated as a leafy vegetable. The earliest evidence of its cultivation goes all the way back to Ancient Egypt. Its leaves are often used for making salads and they are an excellent source of vitamins K and A.
diseases: Virus, downy mildew, powdery mildew, gray mold; cutworms, wireworms, nematodes, aphids, leafhoppers
gardenUse: Garden lettuce (Lactuca sativa) is one of the world's most popular salad plants and has been a mainstay of vegetable gardens since the time of the ancient Egyptians. The plant doesn't really have great aesthetic appeal so it is grown purely for its edible leaves. It grows well in vegetable gardens with peas, peppers, onions, and tomatoes.

name: mango

careGuide.water: Drought-tolerant. Allow the soil to dry completely between watering.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once in spring.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the dead, diseased, overgrown branches in winter.

characteristics.habitat: Humid tropical forests,more open, secondary formations

conditions.difficulty: Mango tree is super easy to take care of, with resistance to almost all pests and diseases. It is a perfect option for gardeners with brown thumbs.
conditions.soil: Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral

description: Mango tree is a large tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It is most well-known for the tropical fruit it produces, and mango is the national fruit of India, Pakistan, and the Philippines. Mango tree can also be used for wood after the tree's fruit production is over. This type of wood is highly prized for making musical instruments.
gardenUse: Mango tree is a fruit-bearing evergreen tree commonly found in tropical and sub-tropical gardens. It is prized for its fragrant blossoms and long, dense green leaves. These leaves can be used as fodder for cattle and is good for boundaries. The timber can be used for furniture. Mango tree is a shade-providing feature plant in tropical gardens. Plant with Marigolds or Mint to deter pests

name: onion

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every half month during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the dead, diseased, overgrown branchesin winter.

conditions.soil: Sand, loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Onion (Allium cepa) is an onion species commonly known for its ubiquitous culinary applications. The onion is toxic to a variety of animals. Aside from its many culinary uses, the onion is often used to teach students how to use a microscope because its cells are very large and easy to visualize.
diseases: White rot, rust, smut, downy mildew, white tip disease; onion fly, leek moth, onion leaf miner
gardenUse: Onion is an easy-care onion variety that finds a popular place in many vegetable gardens. Its pretty tall-stalked flowers also bring eye-catching color to ornamental gardens. The flowers will attract bees, and they are lovely when cut for a vase. Leave room for natural propagation, but they pair well with wild grasses.

name: orange

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.

conditions.difficulty: Growing Mandarin orange is easy as long as you can give them what they need. They are sensitive to certain types of pests and diseases.
conditions.soil: Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral

description: The mandarin orange (Citrus reticulata) is a citrus fruit tree. It is famed for its Mandarin oranges, a commonly consumed fruit which can be eaten plain or used in salads. During the Chinese New Year, the fruit is considered a symbol of good fortune.
gardenUse: Mandarin orange can be a delightful addition to the yard. This small tree produces a sweet, brightly colored citrus fruit whose flavor is a real treat and a welcome reward for the hard-working gardener. These trees are often planted in gardens for their hardiness, fruits, and their small size, which makes them an easy addition. Planting with marigolds, petunias, and borage may help keep away citrus pests.

name: Paprika

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.
careGuide.pottingSuggestions: Plant in pots or ground are both OK

description: The Capsicum annuum plants grow up to 1.5 m high and grow as a bushy subshrub , but mostly stretched upwards . Near the root , the plants lignify relatively easily . The leaves are pointed towards the front , between 5 and 25 cm long and between 3 and 15 cm wide . || As with other cultivated Capsicum species within the Art Capsicum chinense by domestication and the associated long selection a great variability has arisen . Typically , a plant of the species is between 45 cm and 75 cm high , the shoot branches strongly and forms secondary shoots , giving the plant a broad , bushy appearance

name: pea

careGuide.water: Moisture-loving,keep the soil moist but do not let water accumulate.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once  in spring.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased , withered leaves once a month.

conditions.soil: loam, sand; well drained; neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Garden pea (Pisum sativum) is an annual vegetable that makes a hardy, cold weather crop. Also known as the green pea or garden pea, it grows from 1-1.5 foot tall. Peapods form after the first year and both peas and pods are edible and can be eaten cooked or raw. Excellent in stir fry, tender tips, called pea shoots, are also edible.
diseases: Pea Leaf Weevil
gardenUse: Garden Use Garden pea is one of the most common vegetables planted by gardeners across the world. Various types of garden peas can be used in multitudes of dishes, making them very popular in vegetable or raised beds. They also can produce lovely flowers and can be used as a vining addition to flower beds, depending on the type. Garden pea grows harmoniously with chives, carrots, cucumbers, and beans.

name: Peanut
description: Peanut (Arachis hypogaea) is an annual that can grow from 46-61 cm tall. It is a legume crop grown mostly for its edible seeds. Golden yellow flowers bloom in spring and seed begins to develop after flowers fade. The peanut pods grow underground. Cultivated and harvested peanuts and peanut oil are used in a variety of products.

name: pear

careGuide.water: Common pear grows in well-drained mesic loams. It is best to establish routine watering. Deeply water the common pear once a weak to support its growth, but do not overwater the plants.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the dead, diseased, overgrown branches in winter.

conditions.soil: Soil Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral,slighty alkaline

description: The common pear is a tree whose fruit is widely popular and grown all over the world. One way this fruit is unique is that it contains hard particles (called stone cells) within in its flesh that provides a gritty feel when eating. Common pear, when properly cared for, can have a life span of 50-75 years.
diseases: Pear scab, europaean pear rust, brown rot, blossom wilt, fireblight; aphids, caterpillars, codling moth, pear blister mite, pear midge, slugs
gardenUse: The common pear tree it can be a lovely addition to a landscape or garden. Primarily grown for its fruit, it is not often used as an ornamental. Common pear trees will, however, produce lovely flowers and provide a nice shaded area in the lawn. It can make a wonderful addition as a border tree to provide privacy as well since its branches and leaves grow quite densely. Common herbs, allium, and clover are great companions.

name: pineapple

careGuide.water: Pineapple needs plenty of water during its spring and summer growing season. The surrounding soil needs to be kept moist so always water before it dries out. The plant dislikes calcium so don't use hard water and make sure that the water is at room temperature. During winter dormancy, allow the soil to dry a little before watering.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.

conditions.difficulty: Growing Pineapple is easy as long as you can give them what they need. They are sensitive to certain types of pests and diseases.
conditions.soil: Loam; well drained; slightly acidic

description: Pineapple is a short plant that is native to the tropics. Its fruit has a high nutritional value. Peeling off the prickly fruit skin reveals a sweet, aromatic, golden-yellow pulp that is very popular.
diseases: Scale insects
gardenUse: A tropical fruit that is usually grown in edible gardens, the pineapple is typically kept in outdoor containers. The fruit it produces is prized among gardeners. In addition, it is considered easy to grow in the right climates. Companion plants of the pineapple include Gardenia, Bromeliad, and Chinese evergreen.

name: pomegranate

careGuide.water: Water Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once in spring.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.
careGuide.pottingSuggestions: Shallow planting is required during potting.

conditions.soil: Soil Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral,slighty alkaline

description: pomegranate (Punica granatum) is a deciduous shrub or small tree , native to western and southern oarts od Asia .It is a has a long histoet of cultivation and rich symbolism in polytheistic religions.Fruits of pomegranate play an impotant role in many West Asian cuisines
diseases: Eelworms

name: soy beans

careGuide.water: Moisture-loving,keep the soil moist but do not let water accumulate.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once half month during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, overgrown branches in winter.
careGuide.pottingSuggestions: Shallow planting is required during potting.

conditions.soil: Soil Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral,slighty alkaline

description: Soybean (Glycine max ) was domesticated by the chinese 6000 to 9000 years ago.In the eighteenth century,Europeans used soybean for ornamental purposes .Its a versatile plantgrown both for consumption and as an ingredient in manufactured products.

name: spinach

careGuide.water: Moisture-loving,keep the soil moist but do not let water accumulate.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the dead, diseased, overgrown branches in winter.

conditions.soil: Soil Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral,slighty alkaline

description: Spinach (spinacia oleracea) is an edible plants species that is often considered a 'superfood' due to its high content vitamins ,floate,fiber,iron,magnesium and other nutrients.
diseases: Leaf blotch;slugs
gardenUse: Spinach is an annual plant prized for its ability to grow in cooler months in the spring and fall. It is commonly used for  edible properties and ia an essential plant in vegatable gardens.

name: Sunflower

careGuide.water: Common sunflower requires infrequent but deep watering in order to help its roots grow. The key growth period is three weeks before and after flowering; at this time the plant should be watered weekly until the topsoil is moist.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once a month during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves once a month.

characteristics.flower: Yellow , Orange , Black , Red , Purple , Brown , Bronze

conditions.difficulty: Common sunflower is super easy to take care of, with resistance to almost all pests and diseases. It is a perfect option for gardeners with brown thumbs.
conditions.soil: Adaptable; well drained; slightly alkaline, neutral

description: The common sunflower is recognizable for its bright flower on a very tall stem. It is often grown in gardens. These flowers have been important in culture: they were worshipped by the ancient Inca people, and today, they represent eco-friendly movements. The artist Vincent Van Gogh made a famous series of paintings about common sunflowers. Wild versions of the plant branch out to many flower heads, but domesticated plants typically only have one.
diseases: Maladera orientalis, aphids, sclerotinia disease, rust disease, downy mildew, wilt disease, crown rot, leaf blight
gardenUse: The bright and beautiful common sunflower is acommon annual in sunny home gardens. The tallstalks and large sunny blooms make it a beautiful backdrop to many other low-growing flowers in cottage and prairie/meadow gardens. Beans and squash are good veggies to grow with sunflowers, as they help balance the pH in the soil.

name: sweetcorn

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.

conditions.soil: Clay, loam, sand; well drained; slightly acidic,neutral

description: Maize (Zea mays) is a well known domesticated cereal grain first domesticated in Mexico. In much of the world it is also called corn. Worldwide cultivation of maize surpasses other prominent grains like wheat and rice. Maize must be planted in the spring due to its intolerance for cold weather.
diseases: Leaf blotch; slugs
gardenUse: While maize is used almost exclusively as an agricultural food crop, some colorful varieties can be grown in a domestic garden. Gardeners who cultivate these are primarily keeping them for their attractive colors and shapes. Companion plants are often other food crops, like Pumpkin, Basil, or Dill; these can be grown among corn to repel pests and fill in spaces jn the garden.

name: sweetpotato

careGuide.water: Average water needs, watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Deadhead (or remove) withered flowers after flowering.

conditions.difficulty: Growing Paradise apple is easy as long as you can give them what they need. They are sensitive to certain types of pests and diseases.
conditions.soil: loam, sand; well drained; neutral, slightly alkaline

description: You're bound to know the sweet potato; the majority of us have eaten this sweet root vegetable. Many people compare this to the common potato, and the two are related, but very different. You'll often hear the sweet potato being referred to as a yam in the USA.
diseases: Powdery mildew, viral infection; whiteflies, red spider mites
gardenUse: Sweet potato is generally grown in fields. Known mostly for its root vegetable produce, it also creates blooms that add beauty to the garden. This plant does very well as a ground cover plant because it has a wide spread. It also is used to create interest and visual appeal in multi-seasonal gardens because of its interesting foliage. It is a good fit for tropical or container gardens and is commonly planted with other trailing plants with attractive blooms, like petunias or trailing verbenas.

name: Tulip

careGuide.water: watering when the top 3 cm of soil has dried out.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once every 2-3 months during the growing season.
careGuide.pruning: Deadhead (or remove) withered flowers after flowering.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Remarkably, the garden tulip is responsible for the first futures markets, with Dutch traders betting on the future price of uncommon bulbs. One bulb sold for 6,000 florins, which would buy you 60 Ibs of wheat in the 17th century! Most garden tulips will only flower once, blooming in reds, oranges, yellows, pinks, and sometimes, white.
diseases: Tulip fire, tulip breaking virus, bulb rot, bacterial leaf spot, snails and slugs

name: Turnip

careGuide.water: Moisture-loving, keep the soil moist.
careGuide.fertilization: Fertilization once in spring.
careGuide.pruning: Trim the diseased, withered leaves  once a month.

conditions.soil: loam; well drained; slightly acidic, neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Field mustard is similar in appearance to Ragwort but can be distinguished by its characteristic mustard smell. It has the typical Brassica petal formation of four petals in a cross. It generally grows on field edges and roadsides, as well as gardens and waste ground. It's a highly adaptable plant but thrives in well-drained soil.
diseases: Aphids, clubroot, downy mildew, leaf spot

name: watermelon

careGuide.water: Moisture-loving,keep the soil moist but do not let water accumulate.

conditions.soil: loam, sand; well drained; neutral, slightly alkaline

description: Watermelon (Citrullus lanatus) is a flowering plant with a vine-like appearance native to Western Africa. Watermelon bears fruit that are widely cultivated and consumed across the world. Watermelon grow in tropical and temperate climates and requires warmth to grow. There are 1000 varieties around the world.
diseases: Powdery mildew , virus ,fusarium wilt ; aphids, fruits flies ,root-knot nematodes
gardenUse: The watermelon is a popular garden plant in warmer climates. This vine is typically planted in backyard fruit and vegetable garden plots, so that its delicious edible fruit can be harvested right at home. Companion plants of the watermelon often include Pumpkin, Marigold, Squash, and Corn.
